args: Well, I'm stumped. I can't think of any\nother ways to be bad.
What am I gonna do? If I can't figure this\nout, and Halloween ends...
Maybe there's someone around who can\nteach me. ...Hm?
Trick or treat, Odetta! My dear, you grow\nmore beautiful with each passing day.
I fear my heart has been caught in your\nspider's web. O, woe of woes!
Would you deign to grace me with your\nchoice of trick or treat?

I've known many like you, Orion: Bad boys,
ladies' men, wolves dressed as sheep.
You all spout the same nonsense,
and not just on Halloween.
So I think I'll treat myself to a swift exit.\nGoodbye.
Ack! Ah, Lowen. Forgive me, you caught\nme in something of a daze.
What can I do for you, so freshly-jilted\nas I am?
She called you a bad boy, right?
Can you maybe teach me how to\nbe one too? Pretty please!
You wish to be a ＂bad boy＂? Hah!\nLowen, could it be...?
You wish to re-imagine yourself in hopes\nof attracting that special someone, no?
It is a time-tested tactic, my dear boy.\nA little bad behavior goes a long way\nin the game of love.
Sincerity alone will not suffice. No, one\nmust add some SPICE to truly titillate\nthe target of their affection!
And when said person first spies your\nnewly seasoned self, they will surely\nbe knocked flat!
You too can employ this method of\nattraction, though it may prove difficult,\npure-hearted as you are now.
Worry not, my young apprentice! Difficult\ndoes not mean impossible. I shall teach\nyou to wield all such weapons of passion!
I...don't think I totally understand what\nyou mean, but yes please!
Now, our first lesson is on capturing the\nattentions of a lady. And look, a gorgeous\nwoman approaches at this very moment!
What's going on here?\nWhat are you teaching my Lowen?!
Louise, don't blame Orion. I asked him\nto teach me how to be a bad boy.
You'd be sad if I became a bad boy,\nright Louise? I'm such a dummy...
You're not a dummy, Lowen. You must\nhave had a reason for wanting to be\nnaughty, yes?
Why don't you tell me what that is,\nand then we can see if I would be\nsad or not. Okay?
It's already Halloween, and she's not back.
So I thought if I were a bad boy, Garuda\nwould rush back to scold me.
But it's not working! I can't prank right,\nI can't be a bad boy, and Garuda STILL\nisn't back.
You wanted to see Garuda that badly, huh?
Yeah. I know that we're still connected,\neven when we're so far apart, but...
I guess I didn't realize being away from\nmy friend for so long would be so lonely.
I'm sure there's a reason. Garuda would\nnever break a promise to you.
Then how come she's not here?!\nUnless... Yeah. I get it now.
She probably got fed up, right?
I just kept saying how much I wanted\nto see her, over and over and over.\nI was selfish.
I was. I didn't think about what Garuda\nwanted, not one bit.
I only cared about what I wanted,\nand that's what got carried on the wind.
...I've been a bad boy right from the start.
That is absolutely not true, Lowen.\nYou—
I'm done with all that bad boy stuff.\nI'm done being selfish.
I don't want to disappoint Garuda any\nmore than I already have.
I'm sorry I made you worry. But I'm\ngonna do my best to enjoy what's\nleft of Halloween!
Where are you, Garuda?\nLowen needs you.
Is that thunder I hear? Great, now even\nthe weather is going bad.
Unless something changes soon,\nHalloween will be over before you\nreturn...
